title: R-Ladies Bucharest Community #14: chRistmas shaRing Special Edition
description:
De CrÄƒciun, continuÄƒm Ã®ntÃ¢lnirile R-Ladies Bucharest cu o ediÈ›ie specialÄƒ pentru a Ã®nchide acest an 2020 Ã®n #goodRvibes.

Te poÈ›i Ã®nscrie sÄƒ ne Ã®mpÄƒrtÄƒÈ™eÈ™ti ceva despre R sau ce ai Ã®nvaÈ›at/apreciat din Ã®ntÃ¢lnirile noastre lunare. Timebox: ~5min. ÃnregistreazÄƒ-te aici: https://shorturl.at/fqFX6

Join our Christmas session on the 15th December, 7PM EEST to celebrate this year ending in #goodRvibes with a special session.

You can choose to participate as speaker, 5 min /box, see link https://shorturl.at/fqFX6 to share with us feedback on community results or something new/interesting on R.

Of course, you can stay in public! We welcome everyone with same energy & #goodRvibes!

Registration is free, but mandatory via meetup. We shall meet on zoom, and the link will be updated on the day of the event ( PIN for entrance should be sent by email ~2hours before meeting start).

title: R-Ladies Bucharest Community #13: Git, Github, Raspberry pi È™i R
description:
This meetup we have super interesting and techy subjects on the agenda!
- 7 PM - Git & Github pentru R users,
speaker Ana-Maria Niculescu, Lead Data Scientist @ Numeract & co-fondator Bucharest WiMLDS
Ana-Maria is a Python and R aficionado, a data scientist with a creative twist. Ana holds a MSc in Applied Mathematics and Statistics at one of the prestigious "Grandes Ã‰coles" in France, for which she was granted a full scholarship by the French Institute. In addition to that, she holds another MSc and BSc in Computer Science. Since September 2019 she lives in Bucharest and is the leader of a small Data Science team working enthusiastically on diverse projects, some of them being Open-Source.
Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/in/anamarianiculescu/

- 7.40 PM -Raspberry Pi & R,
speaker Frie Preu, Data Scientist @ CorrelAid
Frie is a data4gooder, data scientist and IT person. Right now, she is working full-time for Data4Good network CorrelAid for which she has been volunteering since its beginnings in 2015. There, she is responsible for the coordination of the skilled-volunteering data science projects which are at the core of CorrelAidâ€™s work. In addition, she organizes educational events and workshops.
Frie has a background in social science but transitioned to data science after her Bachelorâ€™s degree and worked in IT consulting for two years. She loves to juggle and visualize data in R and likes to automate all kinds of things using her other programming skills.
Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/in/frie-preu-a2bb46a7/

We meet on Tuesday, the 24th November at 7PM CET+1 ( Romanian time).

Registration is FREE, but mandatory via meetup so we can mail you the PIN code ~2 hours before meeting starts on zoom. Zoom url will be updated in the day of the event.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
CODE OF CONDUCT
Please use few minutes to review our code of conduct before enrollment in our events! We might record this event so more people can use our learnings, so please be aware of this as well! We encourage a safe, open and inclusive space. We act and speak during events using the Code in place: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Yes, this is the place to be in Bucharest for R enthusiasts! #letsR #rladies

title: R-Ladies Bucharest Community #10
description:
Am citit la un moment dat pe unul din blogurile pe care le citesc cÄƒ dacÄƒ Ã®È›i doreÈ™ti sÄƒ ajungi data scientist, scrie un blog! ( David Robinson) AÈ™a cÄƒ am Ã®nceput sÄƒ citesc mai multe bloguri de data scientisti È™i aÈ™a am descoperit blogul lui Rebecca Barter: Data meets Narrative!

Acum cÄƒ ajungem la a 10a Ã®ntÃ¢lnire, vÄƒ Ã®ncurajez sÄƒ continuaÈ›i cÄƒlÄƒtoria cu R È™i sÄƒ Ã®ncepeÈ›i sÄƒ scrieÈ›i un blog cu R Blogdown! È˜i pentru cÄƒ acest Ã®ndemn sÄƒ nu rÄƒmÃ¢nÄƒ doar vorbe, am invitat-o pe Rebecca sÄƒ vinÄƒ speaker, sÄƒ ne povesteascÄƒ È™i sÄƒ ne inspire È™i pe noi Ã®n aceastÄƒ cÄƒlÄƒtorie.

Rebecca este data scientist È™i educator de Data Science la UC Berkeley. Cercetarea ei este orientatÄƒ cÄƒtre sÄƒnÄƒtate. A scris un pachet R superheat È™i este instructor certificat RStudio. È˜i, desigur, scrie un blog grozav despre R È™i Data Science:Data meets Narrative (www.rebeccabarter.com).

VÄƒ aÈ™tept marÈ›i, 30 Iunie la 7PM CET+1 pentru a descoperi mai multe despre R, Blogdown È™i Rebecca Barter. Ãnregistrarea este gratuitÄƒ, dar obligatorie prin meetup.
Evenimentul va fi in limba engleza, vom folosi zoom, link-ul va fi actualizat Ã®n ziua evenimentului. Evenimentul va fi Ã®nregistrat, prin urmare, prin acceptarea Ã®nregistrÄƒrii la acest eveniment, sunteÈ›i de acord È™i cu acest aspect.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
One blog I read at some point was saying: If you are an aspiring data scientist, write a blog (David Robinson). Then I started to read more data scientist blogs and discovered Rebecca Barterâ€™s blog:Data meets Narrative!
Now that we are getting to our 10th meetup, I continue to encourage you to discover R and start writing a blog with R Blogdown! For this I invited Rebecca as featured speaker to share her experience and inspire us!
Rebecca is a data scientist and data science educator at UC Berkeley. Her research is focused on data science in healthcare. She wrote the superheat R package and is also an official RStudio instructor. And, of course, she writes a great blog about R and Data science: Data meets Narrative.

Join our meetup from 30th June, 7PM CET+1 to discover more about R, Blogdown and Rebecca Barter. Registration is free, but mandatory via meetup.
We shall meet on zoom, link will be updated in the day of the event. Your participation in this event, should include your approval for participation in this event that will be recorded.

title: R-Ladies #18: Haifa Ben Messaoud - Take yourself to the next level by challenges
description:
Join us for a new session on the 15th of June, 7PM EET ! We continue our meetups with #goodRvibes and a talk on challenges effect & the #30daycharchallenge with Haifa Ben Messaoud !

Title: Take yourself to the next level by challenges

Haifa Ben Messaoud will share her experience in learning R by participating in different challenges like 30 days chart challenge and tidytuesday.

Haifa is a Data Scientist with over 6 years experience and a background of engineering in statistics and data analysis. In her free time Haifa codes in R and enjoys building beautiful graphs. She loves painting and data visualization.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Registration is free, but mandatory via meetup. We shall meet on zoom, and the link will be updated on the day of the event ( PIN for entrance should be sent by email ~2hours before meeting start).
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
CODE OF CONDUCT : https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/
Please read our Code of Conduct before your first participation.

title: R-Ladies Bucharest: #17 OneHourOnline Event
description:

Este un eveniment in care ne intalnim pentru a discuta despre data & programare cu R, fara agenda.

Daca vrei sa participi, te rog inscrie-te aici si vom reveni cu detaliile de conectare.

title: R-Ladies Bucharest #16: Julia Silge - Three reasons to choose Tidymodels
description:
Join us for a new session on the 23rd of March, 7PM EET ! We continue our meetups with #goodRvibes and a speaker you'll definitely enjoy!

Three reasons to use tidymodels with Julia Silge

Modeling and machine learning in R involve a bewildering array of heterogeneous packages, and establishing good statistical practice is challenging in any language. The tidymodels (tidymodels.org) collection of packages offers a consistent, flexible framework for your modeling and machine learning work to address these problems. In this talk, weâ€™ll focus on three specific reasons to consider using tidymodels. We will start with model characteristics themselves, move to the wise management of your data budget, and finish with feature engineering.

Julia Silge is a data scientist and software engineer at RStudio PBC where she works on open source modeling tools. She is an author, an international keynote speaker, and a real-world practitioner focusing on data analysis and machine learning practice. Julia loves text analysis, making beautiful charts, and communicating about technical topics with diverse audiences.

Registration is free, but mandatory via meetup. We shall meet on zoom, and the link will be updated on the day of the event ( PIN for entrance should be sent by email ~2hours before meeting start).
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
CODE OF CONDUCT :
https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct
Please read our Code of Conduct before your first participation.

title: Shared::Bayesian Multilevel Modelling with {brms}
description:
Oslo useR! r Group alaturi de SkÃ¥ne useR! Group, Copenhagen useR! Group si Stockholm useR! Group ne invita la o intalnire shared in prima luna din noul an! Va fi invitat Paul Burkner, autor al packetului {brms} , care ne va povesti de modelera bayesiana folosind {brms}.
See you theRe!
Ines.
R-Ladies Bucharest Chapter

[About]
This event is organized by the Oslo useR! Group (https://www.meetup.com/Oslo-useR-Group/) and will be co-hosted by the SkÃ¥ne useR! Group (https://www.meetup.com/Skane-R-User-Group/), the Copenhagen useR! Group (https://www.meetup.com/CopenhagenR-useR-Group/), and the Stockholm useR! Group (https://www.meetup.com/StockholmR/).

[Abstract]
The {brms} package provides an interface to fit Bayesian generalized (non-)linear multivariate multilevel models using Stan, a C++ package for performing full Bayesian inference (see https://mc-stan.org/). The formula syntax is very similar to that of the {lme4} package to provide a familiar and simple interface for performing regression analyses. A wide range of response distributions are supported, allowing users to fit â€“ among others â€“ linear, robust linear, count data, survival, response times, ordinal, zero-inflated, and even self-defined mixture models all in a multilevel context. Further modeling options include non-linear and smooth terms, auto-correlation structures, censored data, missing value imputation, and quite a few more. In addition, all parameters of the response distribution can be predicted in order to perform distributional regression. Multivariate models, i.e., models with multiple response variables, can be fit as well. Prior specifications are flexible and explicitly encourage users to apply prior distributions that reflect their beliefs. Model fits can easily be assessed and compared with posterior predictive checks, cross-validation, and Bayes factors.

[Bio]
Paul is a statistician currently working as an Independent Junior Research Group Leader at the Cluster of Excellence SimTech at the University of Stuttgart (Germany). He is the author of the R package {brms} and member of the Stan Development Team. Previously, he studied Psychology and Mathematics at the Universities of MÃ¼nster and Hagen (Germany) and did his PhD in MÃ¼nster about optimal design and Bayesian data analysis. He has also worked as a Postdoctoral researcher at the Department of Computer Science at Aalto University (Finland).

title: Shared::Barcelona R User Group ( + rstudio::global(2021) preview and guests)
description:
Barcelona R User Group - https://www.barcelonar.org/ - ne invita la o intalnire shared in prima intalnire a anului 2021 ! Vor fi invitati de la RStudio si un wokshop de ML al lui Nicolas Attalides, cat si o prezentare despre Big pharmacy data al lui Andrew Ba Tran.

See you theRe!
Ines.
R-Ladies Bucharest Chapter
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
See the agenda below ( with Bucharest time):

7:15 - 7:30 - Set up (systems check) and virtual hellos
7:30 - 8:30 - Workshop*: Introduction to Machine Learning - by Nicolas Attalides
8:30 - 9:00 - "Big pharmacy data: Using R to help turn data over to the public" - by Andrew Ba Tran - (rstudio::global pre-recorded presentation followed by live Q & A session with Andrew)
9:00 - 9:15 - rstudio::global(2021) preview and Q & A - by Curtis Kephart
9:15 - 9:30: Online socialising

*The workshop is designed to be hands-on so if you would like to participate then please join us with your laptop and be ready to code!

Big pharmacy data: Using R to help turn data over to the public
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
This talk will go over how The Washington Post used R to analyze hundreds of gigs of data from the DEA as part of its investigation into the opioid epidemic.
* Dealing with big data in R with doparallel
* Exploratory visualizations and mapping with various packages like RLeaflet and geofacet
* Making an API with janitor for easier data distribution
* Making an R package on top of the API for documentation and vignettes
* Inspiring the creation of a Python library on top of the API to access ARCOS data
* Updating the package so that all parts of the data can be used that will hopefully inspire others to go further than the Post
> Andrew Ba Tran <- is a Data Reporter at The Washington Post

rstudio::global(2021) is a free, virtual event on all things R & RStudio.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
It's hosted over 24-hours â€“ giving people at different timezones a number of options to conveniently engage â€“ with a number of talks and community-engagement events we hope you'll enjoy. It starts on 21st January 2021 @ 4:00 PM GMT.
Learn more about rstudio::global(2021) and register at global.rstudio.com
> Curtis Kephart <- is an Economist and Community Organizer at RStudio

title: R-Ladies #21: Tidy Tuesday
description:
Join us for a new session on the 15th of March, 7:30PM EET ! We continue our meetups with #goodRvibes and a new dataset ready to be discovered.

#TidyTuesday is a weekly data project aimed at the R ecosystem. An emphasis is placed on understanding how to summarize and arrange data to make meaningful charts with ggplot2, tidyr, dplyr, and other tools in the tidyverse ecosystem.
This meetup will be hands-on: after a brief introduction of #TidyTuesday and the weekly dataset, everyone will have a chance to explore the data and then share their work. Whether you want to practice exploratory visualization, apply a new analytical technique, try out a new plot theme or just learn tidyverse things from others, #TidyTuesday is for you.

To get a sense for #TidyTuesday ahead of time, check out the hashtag on Twitter, explore past datasets or check out David Robinson's screencasts below:
https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCeiiqmVK07qhY-wvg3IZiZQ
Registration is free, but mandatory via meetup. We shall meet on zoom, and the link will be updated on the day of the event ( PIN for entrance should be sent by email \~2hours before meeting start).
**CODE OF CONDUCT** : https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/
Please read our Code of Conduct before your first participation.

title: Meetup #20: Packages that help writing efficient R code
description:
Join us for a new session on the 15th of February, 7PM EET ! We continue our meetups with #goodRvibes and a talk on ways to leverage the power of R packages to write code efficiently with Diana Ioan!

Diana is studying Artificial Intelligence at the University of Bucharest and works as R Developer at one of the Big Four accounting firms.

Title: Packages that help writing efficient R code

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

title: R-Ladies #19 Build a new habit in 2022: Tidy Tuesday
